thread.title: Trump endorses 'One China' policy in phone call with Xi Jinping - LA Times
thread.title_full: Trump endorses 'One China' policy in phone call with Xi Jinping - LA Times

author: Jonathan Kaiman
title: Trump endorses 'One China' policy in phone call with Xi Jinping - LA Times

organizations.name: sophomore lamelo ball of chino hills

text:
Trump endorses 'One China' policy in phone call with Xi Jinping Donald Trump on a magazine cover in China Johannes Eisele / AFP/Getty Images A newsstand in Shanghai bears an ad for a magazine featuring U.S. President-elect Donald Trump on the cover. A newsstand in Shanghai bears an ad for a magazine featuring U.S. President-elect Donald Trump on the cover. (Johannes Eisele / AFP/Getty Images) Jonathan Kaiman 
President Donald Trump and Chinese President Xi Jinping spoke by phone on Thursday evening for the first time since Trump’s Jan. 20 inauguration, marking a significant de-escalation in the White House’s aggressive posture towards the world’s second-largest economy. 
Trump told Xi that he would honor the "One China" policy, according to a Thursday statement by the White House Press Office, referring to a diplomatic understanding that the U.S. will not challenge Beijing’s assertion of sovereignty over Taiwan, a self-governing island that Beijing views as a breakaway province. 
“The phone call between President Trump and President Xi was extremely cordial, and both leaders extended best wishes to the people of each others’ countries,” said the statement. “They also extended invitations to meet in their respective countries.” 
President-elect Donald Trump spoke with Taiwan’s president Tsai Ing-wen on Dec. 2, soon after his election win, breaking with decades of diplomatic precedent and drawing a harsh rebuke from China’s foreign ministry. No U.S. president or president-elect is believed to have spoken directly with a Taiwanese leader since the U.S. recognized the mainland government and cut ties with Taiwan in 1979. 
China’s official New China News Agency said in a commentary on Friday morning that U.S-China relations “will stay strong and thrive in a long term even though there have been many talks of uncertainties under the presidency of Donald Trump." Caption 90 seconds: 4 stories you can't miss
